choices.B: Procure new equipment that matches the recommended specifications
choices.C: Recompile the Linux kernel to support the installation.
choices.A: Install the application, as the system meets the application requirements
choices.D: Reconfigure lib modules to support the new application.

questions.question_text:
A junior Linux administrator is installing a new application with CPU architecture requirements that have the following specifications:
✑ x64 bit
✑ 3.0GHz speed
✑ Minimum quad core
The administrator wants to leverage existing equipment but is unsure whether the requirements of these systems are adequate. The administrator issues the following command cat /proc/cpuinfo. The output of the command is as follows:
//IMG//

Which of the following is the recommended course of action the administrator should take based on this output?

comments.content: I agree with you. That doesn't have 3 GHz

discussion.content: Shouldnt the answer be B. Since its only 2.10 Ghz speed?

comments.content: This condition is already met, the output shows core i7
How about the 4 core part? Does that make any different?

discussion.content:
It should be be, the report clearly shows that the CPU speed is insufficient, so it cannot be A

C and D are settings that will do nothing to change a problem with your physical hardware.

B is the only correct option.

Selected Answer: B
The Answer is B. It meets architecture and core requirement but not 3GHz.

Selected Answer: B
CPU speed not met the requirement.

I thought for a while the answer should have been A. But when I checked Intel's website I found my answer: The CPU can go to 3.3GHz in "Max Turbo Frequency", but that's only diverting all the processing power to a single core, in which the quad-core requirement would not work. So the answer is B - Procure new equipment
https://ark.intel.com/content/www/us/en/ark/products/71258/intel-core-i7-3687u-processor-4m-cache-up-to-3-30-ghz.html
It has to be B, 3.0GHz speed is not present in the output.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is troubleshooting an issue where end users are waiting a very long time for processes to respond. The top command reveals that multiple processes seem to be in a non-responsive state or have become zombies.
Which of the following commands should the administrator use to clean up the system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Should be D, -n is not even an option

My answer D. 
To use B we need to provide PID. But -o 15m will kill processes which older than 15 minutes, it should clean up system.

questions.question_text: Which of the following commands would a junior systems administrator run to monitor network traffic actively?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Here: https://www.comparitech.com/net-admin/what-is-tcpdump/

"The packet capture utility used by tcpdump is provided by libpcab, which is a C/C++ library of procedures. The main tcpdump program is the interface for the packet capture process. When run, it will start the libcap process to capture network packets and then display their contents on the screen. Unless a limit to the number of packets to be captured is specified when the program starts, it will continue to run forever. The processing is then terminated by an interrupt signal (Control-C)."

Will continue to run forever...
I believe that answer is D. we want to monitor traffic actively. not just get all network settings. From this commands only tcpdump allows to read traffic. But not sure 100%.

questions.question_text:
A Linux administrator needs to generate SSH keys for remote users. The company security policy requires at least 4096-bit encryption on all public/private key pairs.
Which of the following commands should the administrator issue to comply with company policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The algorithm is selected using the -t option and key size using the -b option. The following commands illustrate:

ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096

so the command is -t rsa -b 4096

choices.B: The USB drive is not formatted
choices.C: The kernel module is not installed
choices.A: The USB drive is formatted as a DVD

discussion.content: B is not correct because there is no any records in logs. it means that OS even did not detect that something was pluged in. In that case I assume that C ir proper answer.
I would think this is C

questions.question_text:
After connecting a USB drive, the system is unable to detect it. There is no entry in /dev, and there is no information in the message log.
Which of the following is the issue?
